info.title: Esplora REST API
info.description: OpenAPI spec for core Esplora endpoints: blocks, transactions, addresses, mining info, mempool, fees, UTXO data and more.

get.description: Returns details about an address. Available fields: address, chain_stats, and mempool_stats. chain_stats and mempool_stats each contain an object with tx_count, funded_txo_count, funded_txo_sum, spent_txo_count, and spent_txo_sum.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Bitcoin address to query

get.description: Returns a list of confirmed and unconfirmed transactions for a Bitcoin address, sorted with the most recent first.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The Bitcoin address to query.

200.description: A list of transactions related to the address.

get.description: Returns up to 25 confirmed transactions for the given address, ordered from newest to oldest. To fetch the next page of results, use the last seen txid from the previous response as the `last_seen_txid` query parameter.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The Bitcoin address to query.

parameters.name: last_seen_txid
parameters.description: The txid of the last transaction from the previous response. Used for pagination.

200.description: A paginated list of confirmed transactions for the given address.

get.description: Returns unconfirmed (mempool) transactions for the given Bitcoin address. Limited to the most recent 50 transactions.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The Bitcoin address whose unconfirmed transactions should be retrieved.

200.description: Array of mempool transactions associated with the address.

404.description: Address not found or no unconfirmed transactions.

get.description: Returns the list of unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs) associated with a Bitcoin address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The Bitcoin address to query.

200.description: A list of UTXOs for the address.

get.description: Checks whether a given string is a valid Bitcoin address on the current network.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The Bitcoin address to validate.

get.description: Returns information about a specific block, including its metadata but not full transaction data.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The block hash to retrieve information for.

get.description: Returns detailed information for a specific block by its hash.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The block hash to query.

get.description: Returns the raw hex-encoded header of a block by its hash. This is a 160-character hexadecimal string representing the 80-byte block header.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash of the block to retrieve the header for.

get.description: Returns status data about a given block, including whether it is in the best chain and what block follows it.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The block hash to query

get.description: Returns a list of transactions in the block with the specified hash. Returns up to 25 transactions per call. Optional query param `start_index` controls pagination.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The block hash.

parameters.name: start_index
parameters.description: Index to start fetching transactions from (pagination).

200.description: A list of transactions in the block.

get.summary: Returns a list of all txids in the block.
get.description: Returns a list of all transaction IDs (txids) in the specified block.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash of the block to query.

200.description: Array of transaction IDs in the block.

get.summary: Get transaction ID by block and index
get.description: Returns the transaction ID at the specified index in the block.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The block hash.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The transaction index within the block.

200.description: Transaction ID at the specified index

get.description: Returns the raw block data in binary form for a given block hash.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash of the block

200.description: Raw block data in binary format

get.description: Returns 10 blocks starting from the specified block height and going backwards.

parameters.name: start_height
parameters.description: The block height to start from.

200.description: A list of 10 blocks starting from the given height

get.description: Returns a list of the most recent blocks. Default is the latest 10 blocks mined.
Returns the block hash of the block at the specified height.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the block.

404.description: Block not found for the given height.

get.summary: Get detailed stats for a block range between minHeight and maxHeight; if maxHeight is not specified, it defaults to the current tip.
get.description: Returns stats for up to 10 blocks between `minHeight` and `maxHeight`, inclusive. If `maxHeight` exceeds the current tip, the response is limited to available blocks.

200.description: Detailed statistics on blocks in the requested height range.

400.description: Invalid range or block limit exceeded

get.description: Returns the height of the tip of the best (most-work) blockchain.
Returns the hash of the most recent block in the best blockchain.

200.description: Block hash string of the latest block

get.description: Returns a list of recent blocks and the corresponding identified mining pools.

200.description: List of mining pools and their recent block counts.

get.summary: Returns details about the mining pool specified by :slug.
get.description: Returns details about the mining pool specified by :slug.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The payout address used by the mining pool.

404.description: No known mining pool associated with the address

get.description: Returns average hashrates (and share of total hashrate) of mining pools active in the specified trailing :timePeriod, in descending order of hashrate. Leave :timePeriod unspecified to get all available data, or specify any of the following time periods: 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, 2y, 3y.

200.description: A list of mining pools with hashrate data.

get.description: Returns all known hashrate data for the mining pool specified by :slug. Hashrate values are weekly averages.
Returns past 10 blocks mined by the specified mining pool (:slug) before the specified :blockHeight. If no :blockHeight is specified, the mining pool's 10 most recent blocks are returned.

200.description: A list of mining pools with block counts.

get.description:
Returns network-wide hashrate and difficulty figures over the specified trailing :timePeriod:

- Current (real-time) hashrate
- Current (real-time) difficulty
- Historical daily average hashrates
- Historical difficulty

Valid values for :timePeriod are 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, 2y, 3y. If no time interval is specified, all available data is returned.

Be sure that INDEXING_BLOCKS_AMOUNT is set properly in your backend config so that enough blocks are indexed to properly serve your request.

Returns the record of difficulty adjustments over the specified trailing :interval:

- Block timestamp
- Block height
- Difficulty
- Difficulty change

If no time interval is specified, all available data is returned.
Returns the current Bitcoin block subsidy, fee reward, and the total block reward based on recent blocks.
Returns aggregate fee, fee rate, and vsize statistics for all transactions in a block (excluding the coinbase).

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Block hash to retrieve fee data for.

get.description: Returns the total block reward, including the block subsidy and total fees (in satoshis).

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash of the block to get the reward for.

get.description:
Returns average feerate percentiles for blocks in the specified :timePeriod, ordered oldest to newest. :timePeriod can be any of the following: 24h, 3d, 1w, 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, 2y, 3y.
For 24h and 3d time periods, every block is included and percentiles are exact (not averages). For the 1w time period, percentiles may be averages depending on how fast blocks were found around a particular timestamp. For other time periods, percentiles are averages.

parameters.name: block_hash
parameters.description: The hash of the block to retrieve fee rates for.

200.description: An array of transaction fee rates in the block (sat/vB).

get.description:
Returns average size (bytes) and average weight (weight units) for blocks in the specified :timePeriod, ordered oldest to newest. :timePeriod can be any of the following: 24h, 3d, 1w, 1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, 2y, 3y.
For 24h and 3d time periods, every block is included and figures are exact (not averages). For the 1w time period, figures may be averages depending on how fast blocks were found around a particular timestamp. For other time periods, figures are averages.

200.description: A list of daily average block size and weight statistics.

get.description: Returns predicted blocks based on current mempool transactions, ordered by fee rate. Each object represents a potential next block with aggregated transaction stats.

200.description: A list of predicted next blocks based on current mempool state.

get.description: Returns audit metadata about a block, including its score based on validation properties.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The block hash to retrieve audit data for.

200.description: Audit metadata and score for the block.

get.description: Returns blocks audit score for the past 16 blocks. If :startHeight is specified, the past 15 blocks before (and including) :startHeight are returned. Available fields: hash, matchRate, expectedFees, and expectedWeight.

200.description: List of audit scores for recent blocks.

get.description: Returns the block audit summary for the specified :blockHash. Available fields: height, id, timestamp, template, missingTxs, addedTxs, freshTxs, sigopTxs, fullrbfTxs, acceleratedTxs, matchRate, expectedFees, and expectedWeight.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Block hash to retrieve the audit summary for.

get.description: Returns current mempool backlog statistics.
Get the full list of txids in the mempool as an array. The order of the txids is arbitrary and does not match bitcoind.

200.description: List of transaction IDs currently in the mempool.

get.description: Returns the list of mempool transactions that are part of a RBF chain.

200.description: RBF replacement metadata for the transaction

404.description: Transaction not found or not eligible for RBF data

get.description: Returns the list of mempool transactions that are part of a Full-RBF chain.
Returns the last 10 transactions that entered the mempool, with simplified metadata.

200.description: A list of recent mempool transactions.

get.description: Returns current mempool as projected blocks.

200.description: A list of virtual blocks representing estimated mempool blocks.

get.description: Returns our currently suggested fees for new transactions.
Returns the ancestors and the best descendant fees for a transaction.

404.description: Transaction not found or not eligible for CPFP.

get.description: Returns details about a transaction. Available fields: txid, version, locktime, size, weight, fee, vin, vout, and status.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: The transaction ID to look up.

get.description: Returns a transaction serialized as hex.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: Transaction ID of the transaction to fetch.

get.description: Returns a merkle inclusion proof for the transaction using bitcoind's merkleblock format.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: The transaction ID to retrieve the merkleblock proof for.

200.description: Merkleblock proof in binary format (as raw hex string)

404.description: Transaction not found or not confirmed

get.description: Returns a merkle inclusion proof for the transaction using Electrum's blockchain.transaction.get_merkle format.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: The transaction ID to get the merkle proof for.

404.description: Transaction not found or not confirmed.

get.description: Returns the spending status of a transaction output. Available fields: spent (boolean), txid (optional), vin (optional), and status (optional, the status of the spending tx).

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: Transaction ID of the parent transaction.

parameters.name: vout
parameters.description: The output index within the transaction.

200.description: Spending status of the transaction output.

get.description: Returns the spending status of all transaction outputs.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: The transaction ID (txid) to query.

200.description: Spending status for each output in the transaction.

get.description: Returns a transaction as binary data.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: The transaction ID.

get.description: Returns the RBF tree timeline of a transaction.

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: The transaction ID to trace RBF replacements for.

200.description: RBF replacement timeline for the transaction.

404.description: Transaction not found or no RBF history available

get.description: Returns the confirmation status of a transaction. Available fields: confirmed (boolean), block_height (optional), and block_hash (optional).

parameters.name: txid
parameters.description: Transaction ID to query.

get.description: Returns the timestamps when a list of unconfirmed transactions was initially observed in the mempool. If a transaction is not found in the mempool or has been mined, the timestamp will be 0.

post.description: Broadcast a raw transaction to the network. The transaction should be provided as hex in the request body. The txid will be returned on success.

200.description: Returns the transaction ID (txid) if successfully broadcast.

400.description: Invalid transaction format or missing body.

500.description: Internal server error while processing the transaction.

BlockHash.description: SHA-256 hash of the latest block

BlockHeader.description: Hex-encoded string representing the block header (80 bytes, 160 hex characters)

BlockHeight.description: Height of the latest block on the best blockchain tip

in_best_chain.description: Whether the block is part of the best (main) chain

next_best.description: Hash of the next block, if available

count.description: Number of blocks mined by this pool in the recent window

url.description: Optional URL of the mining pool

pool_name.description: The name of the mining pool.

hashrate.description: Estimated hashrate of the pool in EH/s.

blocks_mined.description: Number of blocks mined by this pool during the interval.

percent.description: Percentage of network hashrate attributed to the pool.

blocks_remaining.description: Blocks remaining until next difficulty retarget

estimated_date.description: Estimated date/time of the next difficulty adjustment

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp of the data point

hashrate.description: Estimated hashrate in EH/s (exahashes per second)

avgFee.description: Average total fee in recent blocks (in satoshis)

avgTxs.description: Average number of transactions per block

avgValue.description: Average total reward per block (subsidy + fees) in satoshis

subsidy.description: Current Bitcoin block subsidy in satoshis

fee_range.description: Array of fee amounts (in sats) from lowest to highest for all non-coinbase transactions.

vsize_range.description: Array of virtual sizes corresponding to each transaction.

total_fees.description: Total fee (in sats) paid by all non-coinbase transactions in the block.

tx_count.description: Number of non-coinbase transactions in the block.

coinbaseHeight.description: Block height as included in the coinbase transaction.

totalFees.description: Total transaction fees in the block (in satoshis).

txCount.description: Number of transactions in the block.

miner.description: Miner name if known (from known pool tags), otherwise may be null.

value.description: Total reward value (subsidy + fees) in satoshis.

items.description: Fee rate in satoshis per vbyte

blockSize.description: Size of the predicted block in bytes.

nTx.description: Number of transactions expected in this block.

feeRange.description: Min and max fee rate in sat/vB for transactions in this block.

blockSize.description: Estimated size of the virtual block in bytes

blockVSize.description: Estimated virtual size of the virtual block in vbytes

nTx.description: Number of transactions projected in the block

totalFees.description: Total fees in satoshis for transactions in this block

feeRange.description: List of fee rates (in sat/vB) from lowest to highest in this block

size.description: Size of the block in bytes

tx_count.description: Number of transactions in the block

score.description: Audit score for the block (01, where 1 is best)

totalFeesUsd.description: USD estimate at time of block

blockRewardUsd.description: USD estimate at time of block

total.description: Total number of transactions in the mempool.

fullRBF.description: Number of transactions marked as full-RBF.

optInRBF.description: Number of transactions marked as opt-in RBF (BIP125).

nonRBF.description: Number of transactions that are not RBF.

vsize.description: Virtual size of the child transaction in vbytes.

fee.description: Required fee for the child transaction in satoshis.

totalVsize.description: Total virtual size of parent + child transaction.

totalFee.description: Total required fee for parent + child.

rate.description: Effective fee rate (sat/vB) for parent + child.

minRelayFee.description: Minimum relay fee required for the transaction to be accepted into the mempool.

error.description: Error message if CPFP recommendation could not be provided.

TransactionHex.description: Raw hexadecimal representation of the Bitcoin transaction.

count.description: Number of transactions in the mempool

vsize.description: Total size of mempool transactions in virtual bytes

total_fee.description: Total fees paid by mempool transactions in satoshis

fee_histogram.description: Mempool fee-rate distribution histogram as (feerate, vsize) tuples

MempoolTxids.description: Array of transaction IDs currently in the mempool

vsize.description: Virtual size of the transaction in vbytes

fastestFee.description: Recommended fee rate for the fastest confirmation (1 block)

halfHourFee.description: Recommended fee rate for confirmation within 3 blocks (~30 minutes)

hourFee.description: Recommended fee rate for confirmation within 6 blocks (~1 hour)

block_height.description: Block height where the transaction was included.

merkle.description: Merkle branch hashes proving the inclusion of the transaction.

pos.description: Position of the transaction in the block's merkle tree.

spent.description: Whether the output has been spent.

txid.description: Transaction ID of the spending transaction.

vin.description: Index of the input in the spending transaction.

status.description: Confirmation status of the spending transaction.

spent.description: Indicates whether this output has been spent.

txid.description: The transaction ID that spent this output, if any.

vin.description: The input index in the spending transaction.

firstSeen.description: Unix timestamp when the transaction was first observed

addedToMempool.description: Unix timestamp when the transaction entered the mempool

blockTime.description: Unix timestamp when the transaction was confirmed in a block (null if unconfirmed)

block_height.description: Height of the block containing the transaction (if confirmed)

block_hash.description: Hash of the block containing the transaction (if confirmed)

txid.description: Transaction ID of the broadcast transaction.
Transaction ID where the UTXO originates.

vout.description: Index of the output in the transaction.

value.description: Value of the UTXO in satoshis.
